result.execSummary:
The defendant Ayana Kidada Holifield-Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage To Property (Less Than $2,500 damage) [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: case 22CM925, with credit for 3 days served
Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 7/12/22.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
DV assessment imposed.
Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA and DV surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining  balance to be returned to the poster.
Court set restitution at zero.
Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
No contact with firearms.
Court will allow for expungement upon the successful completion of probation.

Complete batterer's intervention program.
Complete Parenting Classes.
Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
Third party contact for the purpose of time with children.
AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ayana Kidada Holifield-Brown in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea and sentencing hearing held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Court held colloquy with the defendant regarding her right to have an in-person hearing.  Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Counts 2, 3, AND 4 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to case 22CM925, with credit for 3 days served. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 24 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Complete Parenting Classes.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Third party contact for the purpose of time with children. 
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Complete 25 hours of community service.
- DV assessment imposed.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
- Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA and DV surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.

- Court set restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 7/12/22.
*Court will allow for expungement upon the successful completion of probation.

Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.
AMENDED Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights, filed.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, filed.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights, filed.

Defendant Ayana Holifield-Brown in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with CLB
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Ayana Kidada Holifield-Brown in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Ayana Kidada Holifield-Brown in custody.  Alicia Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ayana Kidada Holifield-Brown appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Status conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
